name: The Blind Bowman - Monk 6 /Wizard 7 / Arcane Archer 27
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Here is another to add to the pantheon of heroes and heroines – the Blind Bowman.  One part mystic, one part transcendent, and a dash of pain and glory. Built, solo-ed, and playtested from the ground up in the World of Greyhawk Action Server

Most of AC is natural and not Dodge-based, so no need for Uncanny Dodge
 
Builder’s Commentary
This is hardly a new concept, but this particular archer holds a bit of uniqueness in contrast with other Zen Archer builds.  In my attempts to arrive at the ultimate divine damage dealing archer, I was always dismayed at how soft they were in the middle.  This stemmed from the fact they were Dex and Charisma beings, and so lost all of their dodge AC, to include their dex AC, when flatfooted, being flanked in combat, etc.  Because of my solo playstyle, I decided to go another route.  Using the Monk/Wisdom/Zen Archery approach, I was able to cast aside the need for Dexterity and Uncanny Dodge, and stand in the midst of combat jamming arrows down the throats of mine enemy.  Indeed, in going Zen one can also cast aside Weapon Finesse.
 
My other goal was to make the most of the wizard class taking up a class slot, so by going 7 Wizard, one can use the free wizard feat for Craft Wand, and then have a wand for every occasion: Wands of Breach, Wands of Improved Invis, Wands of Invis, and my favorite, Wands of Remove Blindness to counter the Words of Faith spam of which I sometimes fall victim to.
 
The AB is well high enough that you will only miss on rolls of 1 (with a few boss exceptions), and the AC climbs and stays commensurate with the AB.  The high spot score ensures no one is sneaking up on you, and Called Shot: Leg becomes your modus operandi when facing big foes.  The more you land, the more you land, if you catch my meaning.
 
One is free to move skill points around, though Tumble and Spot are a must, and I found keeping Hide and Move Silently was handy.  Discipline is a toss-up, but I ran into a creature that had On Hit: Ruin Armor, and I quickly found myself naked in combat against a beast from the abyss.  The only defense against such attacks is a high discipline, so I decided to err on the side of caution and pump that as well (nobody teaches that at the academy, but Ruin Armor can ruin your day and is a good argument for Discipline, so judge your environment accordingly).
 
  1. Death by Dexterity, Dex based, and is perhaps closest in level split (monk9/wiz7/AA24). Lower AB, and lacks Uncanny Dodge and suffers from questionable feat choices
  2. Wise and Alert Archer by JennaLee. Monk10/Wiz3/AA27, most similar in concept and design, but lacks Craft Wand and Level 4 Wiz spells, slightly lower AB and AC
  3. There was only one Monk/Wiz/Archer in the newer ECB archives, one by Mick Dagger, but is a total Dex monkey and goes heavier on the Wizard side (Wiz13/Monk6/AA21).  Arcane Speed Archer. 
 
If there are others, my apologies, for I cannot tell how current the new logs are being maintained to account for more recent builds in the last couple of years.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
You do not necessarily need Craft Wand on WoG, if you have access to your own or other Player's Wizard Wand crafters (and can use them, as the case is here). Restoration (scroll) will remove Blindness, and an AA normally doesn't have much use for Lesser Breach, anyways (as it is mostly used to blow damage shields off, and AAs don't have difficulties with those).

Impr. Invis, Flameweapon, GMW are all good investments, as can be ILMS for those creatures that have lots of displacement - though an AA doesn't really have much problem still hitting those, what with the flood of arrows that it unleashes.  Stoneskin is...useless.  There.  I said it.  Haste is better imo.  Short lived, but very, very useful.  This is all for WoG, for other environments, YMMV.

With that AB, Called Shot is a feat worth mentioning here, imo - especially Called Shot : Leg.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
It's actually Craft Weapon 5.
The bone wand needed to use this feat may be directly available in modules created with the Hordes of the Underdark expansion, such as the Hordes of the Underdark campaign. Bone wands can also be crafted from large bones if a DC 13 craft weapon check is passed. These large bones are dropped by many skeletons and other standard skeletal creatures (even in older modules, including all official campaigns) whenever the creature's killer has a craft weapon or craft armor skill of at least 6.
As I am not sure if this is actually real or total score (Int affects Craft), I suspect the latter.  That would explain it - allowing for Large Bones to drop from certain creatures and aiding in creating Wands.
